newsitem.title: GERMANY: German July motor vehicle output up 25 pct - VDA.
newsitem.headline: German July motor vehicle output up 25 pct - VDA.

text.p: German motor vehicle output totalled 361,400 in July, up 25 percent from the year-earlier month, the German Automobile Industry Association VDA said on Wednesday.
The association published the following car, van and truck production and export figures for July.

NOTE - The VDA said that adjusted for the number of working days -- July 1996 had 23 versus 21 in July 1995 -- production of passenger cars and vans rose by 16 percent while commercial vehicle production fell three percent.
Seasonally adjusted motor vehicle production was up eight percent from June 1996, the VDA said.

Car orders rose 15 percent in July compared with the year-earlier period, with domestic orders up seven percent and foreign orders up 22 percent, the VDA said. Domestic orders for commercial vehicles rose 35 percent.
